description: Modern science raises important challenges for ethics and religion. Some are theoretical:
can evolutionary and cognitive science be fully accommodated by religious persons and
moral realists? Are the arguments for God's existence helped or hurt by modern science?
Scientific developments also give rise to practical challenges for ethics. Should we
radically enhance human nature? Does neuroscience show that we can't be morally
responsible? Should we worry about global catastrophes? Students explore these or related
questions. Offered annually. Counts toward neuroscience concentration. Prerequisite: completion of
